revised_title: Introducing Diagonal Timber-Work for Enhanced Ship Strength
tldr: Robert Seppings proposed a new shipbuilding method that incorporates diagonal timbers and planks to increase the strength and stability of warships. This innovative approach improves the ship's hull structure, making it more resistant to bending and better able to withstand forces. The new method also enhances the connection between the decks and sides, providing greater overall rigidity.
